data.text: Global inequalities are in bad shape and have worsened due to the pandemic. The latest in the #FandD Picture This series takes stock of where disparities currently stand:  https://t.co/zYT44it63v https://t.co/NRd9zbhhOH

Last week we released new research and analysis on the global economy, the challenge of inflation, rising debt, pandemic recovery and much more. How best should countries move forward? Read the recap of the Spring Meetings here: https://t.co/C5ZR2K9ay6 https://t.co/eFNiOWWy0u

Higher commodity costs and broader price pressures will cause faster consumer-price increases this year for advanced economies and emerging market and developing economies. Read more in #IMFBlog: https://t.co/q8hIplEUKG https://t.co/9daLnGwZHp

The war in Ukraine is shaking the global economy & raising uncertainty about the outlook for Latin America and the Caribbean. 

📺Watch IMF Western Hemisphere Director @igoldfajn discuss the economic outlook for the region. https://t.co/7UKpPwD5sF #IMFAmericas
Current global inequalities are extreme. As our latest #FandD graphic shows, the richest 10% own 76% of the world’s wealth. https://t.co/zYT44it63v https://t.co/4xAtdMUfHS

TOMORROW, Thursday, April 28, at 7:00 AM ET (1:00 PM CAT): Join us for a live press briefing with @aselassie on the economic outlook for sub-Saharan Africa. Watch here: https://t.co/JStBGpZFNu #IMFAfrica https://t.co/c6A28kvTrI

More diversification in a country’s trade, not less, improves resilience of the economy. Read our #IMFBlog to find out how greater diversification and greater substitutability within global value chains can help lessen the impact of future shocks. https://t.co/HtUArzw5T1 #WEO https://t.co/oMVTTk3T7Q

Curious about all our latest projections for the economic outlook for countries in the Middle East, North Africa, Caucasus, and Central Asia? #REO  

Learn more here ➡️ https://t.co/1Qwtg2s6hT https://t.co/Jlf6BefrG5

Countries in the Middle East, North Africa, Caucasus, and Central Asia have difficult policy decisions to make in the months ahead. Here’s how to prioritize:

https://t.co/1Qwtg2s6hT https://t.co/tNaCD5fLsv

Higher food prices, supply shortages, and a reliance on wheat imports from #Russia and #Ukraine are threatening the affordability and availability of basic food staples for countries in the Middle East, North Africa, Caucasus, & Central Asia.

Learn more: https://t.co/1Qwtg2s6hT https://t.co/FucQoNi17a

The #WarInUkraine is setting back the recovery, especially for oil importers in the Middle East and North Africa that are facing high #debt and rising inflation. 

📜 Our latest Regional Economic Outlook explains: https://t.co/1Qwtg2s6hT https://t.co/l67gHBbGXN

Inflation in the Caucasus and Central Asia surged to 9.2% in 2021, driven mainly by higher food prices. We expect it to rise further to 10.7% in 2022. 
https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/qlMkc5aoCw

#Inflation in the Middle East and North Africa surged to 14.8% in 2021, driven mainly by higher food prices. And we expect it to remain high at 13.9% in 2022.

Learn more in our latest Regional Economic Outlook: https://t.co/1Qwtg2s6hT https://t.co/pUKU3sZFK8

JUST RELEASED: Our latest growth projections for the Caucasus and Central Asia: 
We expect growth to slow from 5.6% in 2021 to 2.6% in 2022 largely due to the #UkraineWar. 
https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/LwSyZn3U1M

NEW: Our latest growth projections for the Middle East and North Africa: 
We expect growth to slow from 5.8% in 2021 to 5% in 2022. Growth is largely fueled by oil and gas exporters like Saudi Arabia. But the prospects for emerging markets and low-income countries are worsening. https://t.co/BrmL4rh7IO

Poverty and inequality remain key concerns in Latin America and the Caribbean, as the most vulnerable groups in the region are being hit hard by the increase in food and energy prices.

More details on our #IMFBlog: https://t.co/esES8uKVrV #IMFAmericas #Inflation https://t.co/h5ssc9UINB

The war in Ukraine & tighter financial conditions are among risks that cloud growth prospects for the #LatAm region. After a sharp rebound in 2021, growth is returning to pre-pandemic levels, slowing to 2.5% for 2022.

More on our #IMFBlog https://t.co/esES8uKVrV #IMFAmericas https://t.co/61sf9uRd17
Priorities for policymakers in Latin America & the Caribbean. https://t.co/kdQmmCzduw #IMFAmericas https://t.co/gsvYujdcYh

Labor markets have recovered rapidly in North America and Europe following the pandemic. Yet the recovery has differed significantly across countries, sectors, and population groups. Watch the discussion w/@Tboeri, @lkatz42, @mioana and @pogourinchas here: https://t.co/9aLpdrVyvX https://t.co/gX8KoxvScb

🔴 LIVE EVENT: IMF Chief Economist @pogourinchas moderates a discussion on recent labor markets dynamics across advanced European economies and North America, and the path ahead. https://t.co/tldOyqtVlc https://t.co/sEmacpdTBb

#Inflation in Latin America’s largest economies is the highest in 15 years. We estimate that a combined 10 percentage points increase in oil and food prices would push inflation up by 1.1 percentage points. 

➡️ Learn more: https://t.co/kdQmmCzduw #IMFAmericas https://t.co/Bs5IgHhZ3f

Growth is slowing in Asia, where policymakers face difficult trade-offs. They should protect the vulnerable from rising fuel and food costs, and enact economic reforms to boost long-term growth. #IMFBlog has more: https://t.co/jHhSbVTm97 https://t.co/SorWT6gG2Z

IMF growth projections for 2022 in Latin America & the Caribbean:

🇦🇷 Argentina: 4.0%
🇧🇷 Brazil: 0.8%
🇨🇱 Chile: 1.5%
🇨🇴 Colombia: 5.8%
🇲🇽 Mexico: 2.0%
🇵🇪 Peru: 3.0%

Caribbean:
➡️ Tourism dependent: 3.2%
➡️ Commodity exporters: 20.2%

https://t.co/kdQmmCzduw #IMFAmericas https://t.co/SMZaTa41DQ

These conditions prompt policymakers to raise interest rates and implement measures to soften the blow of higher food and energy prices on the most vulnerable and to contain risks of social unrest. [2/2] https://t.co/kdQmmChCCY #IMFAmericas

The war in Ukraine raises uncertainty about the outlook for Latin America and the Caribbean and brings inflationary shock on top of another one in the wake of COVID. [1/2] #IMFAmericas https://t.co/n4eGe3yrcw

We expect economic growth in Latin America & the Caribbean to slow in 2022, after a strong yet divergent recovery across countries last year. https://t.co/kdQmmCzduw #IMFAmericas https://t.co/GmpoKDl6BR

Countries in the Middle East, North Africa, Caucasus, and Central Asia are some of the hardest hit by the #UkraineWar. Hear from Jihad Azour what this means for growth in 2022 with the release of our Regional Economic Outlook, April 27 at 7 AM ET. #REO 
https://t.co/XkvVT7S35N

Economic growth in Asia and the Pacific will slow this year to 4.9%, less than last year’s 6.5% pace, amid the war in Ukraine, a resurgent pandemic, and rising interest rates. Learn more here: https://t.co/jHhSbVTm97 // #IMFBlog https://t.co/vntPAsMkaw

Starting now at 7pm ET: What's the latest economic outlook for Asia and the Pacific? Tune in now to hear new research and analysis of the region from the IMF's Anne-Marie Gulde-Wolf, Krishna Srinivasan, and Sanjaya P. Panth:  https://t.co/shhYnqLfR0
@savechildrenuk @AJack @KCTDUHO @HadilAlashwal @VladislavKaim @CavalcantiRK

Cross-border use of digital money raises new questions and calls for new policies. Policymakers need to act decisively. 

▶️ Watch the panel discussion "Money at a Crossroad: Public or Private #DigitalMoney?" https://t.co/0pvsAJ9jQo #CBDC https://t.co/WAiBqAP7cn

TODAY, Apr 25 at 2:00 PM: Join the discussion with IMF Deputy Managing Director, Bo Li, Gwen Hines @savechildrenuk, FT’s Andrew Jack @AJack, and #IMFYouth Fellows on how to offset the economic impact of the pandemic and the war in Ukraine: https://t.co/Co5Z11Nf6V https://t.co/4rEzOnlEyX

Global public debt is expected to fall in 2022 and then stabilize at about 95 percent of gross domestic product over the next few years, 11 percentage points higher than pre-pandemic. Read the #IMFBlog based on the latest #FiscalMonitor to learn more. https://t.co/gKzxHSJl7k https://t.co/FEmenKCUv0

We forecast 3.8% growth in the emerging market and developing economies group in 2022 - a 1 percentage point downgrade from our January forecast. Our latest World Economic Outlook looks at how to improve the outlook. https://t.co/J6EVpjwBqt #WEO https://t.co/4UlzkbRW6K

Miss our Spring Meetings last week? Catch up on all the highlights here: https://t.co/C5ZR2K9ay6 + sign-up to our newsletters to stay up-to-date on this week's regional economic outlooks: https://t.co/N7IQ0VLjI5 // #IMFMeetings https://t.co/0JKR1RYizB

The outlook for financial stability in Europe has deteriorated. Central banks must keep watch on shifts in investors' risk appetite and the availability of liquidity and credit to maintain stability amid war and sanctions. Read our latest #REO: https://t.co/0cAaFiVk7n https://t.co/Lb5jv7nKgf
How are global financial and economic policymakers seeking to address rising #inflation? Learn more in this recap of our #IMFMeetings: https://t.co/EdpbNLpdwB https://t.co/nUxeYLEzRf

The advanced economies group will grow at 3.3% in 2022. The latest #WEO explains the different reasons for the downgrade in countries in this group like the USA, Canada, UK, Japan, and Germany. https://t.co/J6EVpjwBqt #WEO https://t.co/OK8Ji9q7IC

Where does the IMF stand on central bank digital currencies (#CBDCs), digital money, fintech and crypto? Check out this recap of our Spring Meetings last week to learn more: https://t.co/C5ZR2K9ay6 // #IMFMeetings https://t.co/JQxqjk71NP

Starting now: #FiscalForum: Building Resilience to Shocks. @pogourinchas @MamtaMurthi @austindemby @MarkusEconomist @rcerdan @Ministere_Sante discuss lessons from COVID-19 to help countries prepare for future crises.
https://t.co/4RTkkN3ziQ https://t.co/VqW4SWzTCc

In the #GlobalEcon debate, IMF Chief @KGeorgieva echoed the views of emerging and developing countries on the need to protect the gains from economic integration to benefit all people. https://t.co/VEhOZXYuXZ https://t.co/4APuQIksXN

Join the #FiscalForum TODAY at 8AM ET as @pogourinchas, @MamtaMurthi @austindemby @MarkusEconomist @rcerdan @Ministere_Sante explore how policy makers can continue to transform economies, social safety nets, and health care systems to become more resilient to global shocks. https://t.co/DesnV6LHfT

As demand grew rapidly in 2021, bottlenecks held back supply, including COVID outbreak-induced factory closures, restrictions at ports, congested shipping lanes, container shortfalls, and worker shortages. Our #WEO explains. https://t.co/J6EVpjOcP3 https://t.co/vuqKUpSSdL

Prime Minister @miaamormottley discussed how countries like Barbados are dealing with inflation and debt at the #GlobalEcon debate. Watch the replay here. https://t.co/VEhOZXYuXZ https://t.co/IGjpgDdf0k

COVID-19 has highlighted the central role resilient social safety nets and health care systems play to protect people hit by shocks. Join the #FiscalForum to learn more. @pogourinchas @MamtaMurthi @AustinDemby @MarkusEconomist @rcerdan @Ministere_Sante  

https://t.co/D75TcxMfi0 https://t.co/pitDEqu05k

What issues resonate with youth globally? Join Deputy Managing Director, Bo Li, Gwen Hines, FT’s Andrew Jack @AJack, and #IMFYouth Fellows as they discuss how to offset the economic impact of COVID and the war in Ukraine. April 25 at 2 PM ET. https://t.co/Co5Z11Nf6V https://t.co/e4d8u4bgxP

Social safety nets and health care systems can pave the way for an inclusive, sustainable, & resilient recovery to protect the most vulnerable. Learn more w/@pogourinchas @MamtaMurthi @AustinDemby @MarkusEconomist @rcerdan @Ministere_Sante #FiscalForum

COVID-19 had uneven effects on incomes. In some advanced economies and emerging markets, government support protected incomes. In most other countries, incomes fell and poverty rose as governments had less capacity to help. Read the latest #Fiscal Monitor
https://t.co/Ww7C7hU1pp https://t.co/3l6WMs12E7

As financial challenges grow under the strain of war in Ukraine, governments need to create space to support people impacted by rising food and fuel prices. Learn more about how governments can help from our latest #REO: https://t.co/0cAaFiVk7n https://t.co/xkHFT0TnBa

The war in Ukraine sets back Europe’s economic recovery and compounds the challenges created by the pandemic. Policymakers face issues with energy supply, an increased flow of refugees, and overall lower growth. https://t.co/0cAaFiVk7n https://t.co/GUWeTywBMP

The war in Ukraine is adding more pressure on inflation in Europe. The IMF forecasts inflation in 2022 to reach 5.5 % in advanced economies and 9.1 % in emerging European economies. Learn more: https://t.co/0cAaFiVk7n https://t.co/nNinsYg4iC

We project inflation in 2022 at 5.7% in advanced economies and 8.6% in emerging market and development economies—1.8 and 2.7 percentage points higher than projected in January. Our analysis here: https://t.co/SFp7kGgvom #WEO https://t.co/pmR1PN3FSf

Today's key takeaway from #IMFMeetings: the IMF downgraded its global growth outlook, reflecting the impact of the war in Ukraine, the risks posed by inflation, and more. Read our recap of the day here: https://t.co/t85JsfVouU https://t.co/TNvBQdTNgp

Chief Economist @pogourinchas: The war and sanctions significantly impact Russia's economy. We are projecting that output will shrink by -8.5% in 2022. This impact could even become larger if the sanctions are tightened further. https://t.co/MM02mflnGf #WEO https://t.co/mLZI2z4qwt
